intro: Peucedanum geyeri, commonly known as Geyeri's angelica, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers in umbels. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
